Package ray.rage.rendersystem

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Renderable
    A renderable is a discrete object that can be rendered by a render-system.
    RenderQueue
    A render queue defines an ordered container for renderables to be submitted to the render-system by the scene-manager.
    RenderQueue.Listener
    A listener that allows interested clients to receive render-queue events.
    RenderSystem
    A render system defines the functionality of a low-level 3D API.
    RenderSystem.Capabilities
    The capabilities represent a description of the attributes supported by a render-system.
    RenderSystemFactory
    A factory that creates render-systems.
    RenderWindow
    A render window is what's presented as the main application widget for user interaction.
    Viewport
    A viewport is a 2D rectangle that defines the size of the rendering surface onto which a 3D scene being rendered from a camera's point of view is projected.
    Viewport.Listener
    Listener interface to notify clients of events affecting viewports.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    Renderable.DataSource
    Specifies whether the render-system should use data from a vertex buffer or an index buffer for drawing operations.
    Renderable.Primitive
    The primitives to be used by the render-system to render this renderable.
    RenderSystem.API
    The API is the application programming interface the render-system is expected to use for its interactions with the GPU.
